page.title: 03CLUBS
page.content: {HARLYN RESCUE SURF LIFESAVING CLUB The Club House is situated on the east side of Harlyn Bay by the stone bridge which spans the little river which winds down from Trenearne valley. The Club has approximately 50 members, boat crew members numbering 18. All members give their services voluntarily to save life on and off the beach and cliffs of Harlyn Bay. They are supported entirely by contributions from the public. . The Rescue Boat is an inflatable craft, with a jet engine, operated by a crew of three. The Club effects currently about forty rescues a year, including windsurfers, airbeds with their young occupants, small boat capsizes and swimmers. Harlyn Bay is situated on the west side of Trevose Head.
